title: MIgrate Old Thunderbird Profile to New Install
creator: paulp575123
content:
How do I migrate the old Thunderbird profile to the new Thunderbird? Background: Up until mid-Jan 2024 I was using Thunderbird on Windows 7. In mid-Jan I did a "clean" install of Windows and installed Thunderbird. Due to a corrupted Windows installation, I had to do another "clean" install of Windows 10 Pro. Today I installed Thunderbird version 115.9.0. Everything went well. However, I don't have access to my old - pre-mid Jan profile - which has e-mails and contacts I need to access. Here's my setup: Thunderbird installed in D:\Thunderbird New Thunderbird profile is in M:\Thunderbird Old Thunderbird profile is in M:\Thunderbird-OLD

How do I migrate/import the old messages, address book/contacts, and find out which extension I had installed?

Thanks.
metadata: ;category:download-and-install;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:124.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/124.0;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird not recognizing my profile, starts as new?
creator: sesik1
content:
Hi, I started my laptop as normal and opened Thunderbird to check emails which was fine. In the middle of checking emails the laptop just switched off unexpectedly (still don't know why). I restarted the laptop and was prompted to do a disk check which I did then it booted up fine. I started Thunderbird again but it came up as setting up a new account not recognizing my existing profile accounts which are multiple. I've spent hours searching for a solution, which led me to the prefs.js issue. I followed some instructions to rename the prefs-1.js file which I did and it partially worked but not to my original settings and all accounts. I then copied and renamed an older backup version of the prefs.js file which also worked but then included accounts I didn't have anymore. I'm trying to get back my original prefs.js settings but don't know how to or if it's possible at all.

Thank you in advance.
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/123.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Problema menú contextual ENVIAR A
creator: -Betelgeuse-
content:
Saludos a todos, os planteo el problema que me ha surgido, selecciono unos archivos y con el botón dcho en el menú contextual voy a ENVIAR A y elijo DESTINATARIO DE CORREO y me abre la ventana de redacción del correo y SOLO aparece UNO de los ARCHIVOS seleccionado. Estoy buscando información por la red y lo que encuentro no me da solución, la unica que he encontrado es añadir un acceso directo al archivo Thunderbird.exe y colocarlo en la carpeta SENDTO pero solo añade un archivo.

Antes funcionaba perfectamente además me salía una información en el cuerpo del mensaje que ya no aparece.

¿Alguien sabe como poder solucionar este problema y que añada todos los archivos seleccionados?

Gracias

title: Thunderbird v115.9.0 (32-bit) not sending Yahoo email
creator: fph1
content: Hello. Cox Communication is our ISP. Cox recently migrated all cox.net email accounts to Yahoo! mail. Yahoo! mail now works fine on Apple devices -- iPhones and iPads. Yahoo! mail can be received on Thunderbird but not sent. The error message is: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.mail.yahoo.com was lost in the middle of the transaction. Try again." MAIL PROVIDER: Yahoo! ISP: Cox Communications FIREWALL/ANTIVIRUS SOFTWARE: BitDefender Premium/Total Security Build 27.0.30.140 OPERATING SYSTEM: Windows 10 Business; Version 22H2; OS Build 19045.4170 THUNDERBIRD VERSION: 115.9.0 (32-bit) SMTP SETTINGS: SERVER NAME: smtp.mail.yahoo.com PORT: 587 and also have repeatedly tried using port 465 CONNECTION SECURITY: SSL/TLS AUTHENTICATION METHOD: have tried both Normal Password and OAuth2 CONNECTION SECURITY: SSL/TLS USER NAME: have left blank (as I have multiple email user names) and even tried using a single account name

title: "TB is not responding" (hangs).  And "message read" must be invoked manually.
creator: rp108
content:
Hello Everyone,

I have TB 115.9.0. Windows 7.

1. Since the first Supernova release, TB crashes 3-4 times a day. I have a vague sense that it happens when TB is not the main "focus" for some period of time. It frequently happens when I log in after having previously "locked" the Windows workstation.

On most of the updates, I review the update info. Maybe I have missed it, but I have never seen any mention of work on discovering the cause of, and solving, the crashes.

2. Since the first Supernova release, TB does not mark a message as "read" after opening it and reading it. It is necessary to manually mark it read.

Mostly I am just reporting my experience with TB, in case that is useful to anyone.

Best regards to all.

Thank you.
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0;product:thunderbird

title: Calendar files
creator: aholtby
content:
Something changed at some point in time with the calendar file. When I started using Thunderbird I was able to set up entries in the calendar file and give them names and an associated colour. I can't seem to do that any longer. Eg. I set up entries for Birthdays which showed on the calendar as purple and Anniversaries where green. I can't do that anymore. Was that ability removed at some time?

Another situation I came across was importing .ics files. The method changed and now you have to open a file. What it does is ask where you want to put the contents, ie as an Event or a Task. I tell it where I want it put . But when I check the entry it shows as the .ics file and not as an Event or Task. Then I have a terrible time trying to remove it. Nothing happens when I tell the program that the Event/Task is completed. HELP!

title: Threading nightmare - messages missing
creator: nuffsaid1
content:
From David, Top Ten Contributor: "I am trying to assist, but I don't grasp what you are experiencing, since it is not what I think of as threading. You're saying the folder is unthreaded, yet the messages appear threaded by subject. Maybe some other voluhteer on the forum will offer some insight."

All the threading help is oriented to something I can set on the menu bar that also includes Date, From, Size, etc. I wish my threading problem was that easy. Threading is not chosen, never has been. Then suddenly April 2, 2024 6:30pm est, all my e-mails that had a thread got threaded, with arrows showing up in the subject of the e-mails.

There is a symbol on a different bar with choices like Sort By --> Threaded or unthreaded. All this does is hide e-mails that are even threaded or unthreaded, but it shows that what happened to me is also called "threaded." The term "threaded" has two meanings or definitions or uses or whatever, which makes asking for help all the more difficult. People keep telling me about the menu when I have a choice of threading, not realizing, as I think David didn't, that threading is also elsewhere in the thunderbird software.

And when I choose to show threaded, that e-mail I was sending on April 2 does not show up, but if I search for the file, it does show up. So it is there, but invisible. This whole threading situation just gets worse and worse. I need that file in particular, as it happens.

Thanks to anyone who read all this.
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:124.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/124.0;product:thunderbird
